availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: D. Matthewson (Calloway County, KY, merchant and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, merchant. Tennessee native. Married to L. G. Mathewson. Father of J. T. Mathewson, Mary A. Mathewson, Tobias Mathewson, Celia B. Mathewson, William E. Mathewson, Emily C. Mathewson, Frances R. Mathewson. Engaged in commerce in Calloway County in 1840. Owned one enslaved person in Calloway County in 1840. Merchant in Calloway County in 1850. Employed R. A. Graham as a merchant in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Merchant in Calloway County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Calloway County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, Wadesboro, p. 81.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 482B-483A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 5 of 6 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 196.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 2 of 19 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
KYR-0004-033-0001.
